ygData.subject: Solution to Trouble on OS X: PYTHON_CMD environmental variable
ygData.msgSnippet: I have found a solution to my own problem.  I will describe the solution, then my symptoms.  However, this solution was found not by myself, but with the help

Subject: Solution to Trouble on OS X: PYTHON_CMD environmental variable
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=247653205; y=9TL-fPUsG6LC9NW2bmg5OCt_V3bgoh6gN0dxQmLY4gg6U4gK
X-Yahoo-Profile: wsburbank
X-Yahoo-Newman-Property: groups-system
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 01 Jan 2008 08:44:27 -0000

I have found a solution to my own problem.  I will describe the  
solution, then my symptoms.  However, this solution was found not by  
myself, but with the help of a mac guru, so I will most likely not be  
the best to ask for further detailed questions.

The Solution to "needing to set environment variable PYTHON_CMD"
My solution was to create a new directory ~/.MacOSX and to create  
environment.plist (see websites: http://www.astro.washington.edu/owen/AquaEnvVar.html 
  and http://developer.apple.com/qa/qa2001/qa1067.html)
My working environment.plist file looks as follows.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple Computer//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd 
">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
         <key>PYTHON_CMD</key>
         <string>/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/Current/ 
bin/python</string>
</dict>
</plist>

After Restarting my OS/computer everything seems to work as it should!

My SYMPTOMS:
My case goes as follows: I had OS X 10.4 Tiger, I installed python,  
numarray, sundials, matlab, cantera and everything worked great!  I  
then upgraded to OS X 10.5 Leopard; everything worked great!  I then  
upgraded Python and everything went to hell.  From the python shell  
and Matlab I got errors such as ctm2ct error set PYTHON_CMD (not exact  
error, but close).
Even after several reinstalls, I got the same errors, and after being  
reminded to run the python setup.py scripts, same errors.

Upon further investigation, typing env into the terminal I saw that  
PATH was set to cantera but no PYTHON_CMD.  I then opened the  
setup_cantera file into textedit, and pasted the commands into the  
terminal.  Typing env again showed PYTHON_CMD was set, but I still got  
the same errors.
Oddly and very repeatedly, if I closed that terminal and immediately  
or any other time after opened a new terminal window and typed env  
again PYTHON_CMD was absent.

My Linux savy friend then suggested modifying the bash-profile (not  
exactly sure) to add the environment variable.  Now any new terminal  
window would always show PYTHON_CMD as set.  However we read in the  
bash-profile script that this was for interactive windows only, and  
hence when demos where run from python shell or Matlab I still  
received the same errors.
We then tried the bash-rc file (still not exactly sure), restarted and  
nothing new happened.
Additionally we discovered from the terminal if we ran a demo such as  
python equilibrium.py, it ran!  But starting the demo from IDLE and  
selecting Run -> Run Module, opened a python shell and returned the  
same errors as above, need to set PYTHON_CMD.

I now met with the mac guru, and upon investigating everything  
described above, and reading the two linked websites (same as above: http://www.astro.washington.edu/owen/AquaEnvVar.html 
  and http://developer.apple.com/qa/qa2001/qa1067.html)
he then tried the above solution, restarted and... Everything now  
seems to work as it should!! The Python shell and Matlab!

Well I thought it is important to contribute back and I am sorry I do  
not understand my problem well enough to keep others from having the  
same problem, but at least now they have a better starting off point  
to find a solution.

Winston Burbank
University of Alaska Fairbanks
